content.question: A long, straight horizontal wire carrying a current <math alttext="2.0 amperes" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is in a region with a <math alttext="5.0, times 10 to the negative 5 power, teslas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>T</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> magnetic field that is directed at an angle of <math alttext="58 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>58</mn><mi>°</mi></mrow></math> below the horizontal. What is the magnitude of the magnetic force per unit length exerted on the current-carrying wire?

choices.label: <math alttext="0.5, times 10 to the negative 4 power, newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mfrac><mrow><mtext> N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="0.85, times 10 to the negative 4 power, newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.85</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mfrac><mrow><mtext> N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1.0, times 10 to the negative 4 power, newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mfrac><mrow><mtext> N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1.2, times 10 to the negative 4 power, newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mfrac><mrow><mtext> N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1.9, times 10 to the negative 4 power, newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.9</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mfrac><mrow><mtext> N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="0.85, times 10 to the negative 4 power, newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.85</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mfrac><mrow><mtext> N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 12.3: Magnetic Fields of Current-Carrying Wires and the Biot-Savart Law

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
